title: How to Create a Minecraft Account

steps.headline: Go to the Minecraft website.
steps.description: Go to https://minecraft.net/ in your preferred browser.

steps.headline: Click LOG IN.
steps.description: This link is in the top-right corner of the Minecraft page.

steps.headline: Click the Register one here!
steps.description: link. You'll find this option at the bottom of the page and next to the "Don't have an account?" line of text. This will take you to the account creation page.

steps.headline: Enter your Mojang account information.
steps.description:
Fill out the following fields:

Email address - The email address you want to use for your Mojang account. Repeat email address - Re-enter the email address from above. Password - The password you'll use to log into your Mojang account. Repeat password - Re-enter the password you entered above. Date of Birth - Select the day, month, and year of your birth.

steps.headline: Click CREATE ACCOUNT.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the page. This will prompt an identity verification window.

steps.headline: Verify your identity.
steps.description: This usually entails selecting all images in the window that match a certain description, then clicking Verify. You may just have to enter a phrase that is displayed on the screen.

steps.headline: Get the code that Mojang sent you.
steps.description:
To finish creating your account, you'll need to enter a four-character code that Mojang sends to the email you entered earlier:
Go to your email inbox. Open the email from Mojang with the subject "Mojang email verification". Look for the four-character code in the body of the email. It's also after the word "verification" in the email's subject.

steps.headline: Enter the code.
steps.description: Type the four-character code into the text box near the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Click VERIFY.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will create your account and take you to the Minecraft purchase page. At this point, you can proceed with purchasing Minecraft, or you can exit the page—either way, your Mojang account has been created.

methods.name: Migrating a Minecraft Account to a Mojang Account

steps.headline: Go to the Mojang Account Migration page.
steps.description: Open https://account.mojang.com/migrate in your web browser. If you have an old Minecraft Premium account, you can migrate it to a Mojang account, which provides more security options and integrates Minecraft into your Mojang game library.

steps.headline: Enter your Minecraft details.
steps.description:
These are the details from your Minecraft premium account. Fill out the following fields:

E-mail - Your Minecraft Premium account's email. Username - Your Minecraft Premium username. Password - Your Minecraft Premium password.

steps.headline: Enter your new account's details.
steps.description:
These are the preferred details for your new Mojang account. Fill out the following fields:

E-mail - The email address you want to use. Repeat E-mail - Re-enter the email from above. Date of Birth - Select the day, month, and year of your birth.

steps.headline: Check the "I accept..." box.
steps.description: It's directly below the Date of Birth section. This indicates that you accept Mojang's terms of use.

steps.headline: Click Migrate account.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the page. This will take you to an email verification page.

steps.headline: Retrieve the code that Mojang sent you.
steps.description:
To finish creating your account, you'll need to enter a four-character code that Mojang sends to the email you entered earlier:
Go to your email inbox. Open the email from Mojang with the subject "Mojang email verification". Look for the four-character code in the body of the email. It's also after the word "verification" in the email's subject.

steps.headline: Enter the code.
steps.description: Type the four-character code into the text box near the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Click VERIFY.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will migrate your Minecraft account over to your Mojang email address.

text:
Creating a New Minecraft Account Go to the Minecraft website. Go to https://minecraft.net/ in your preferred browser. Click LOG IN. This link is in the top-right corner of the Minecraft page. Click the Register one here! link. You'll find this option at the bottom of the page and next to the "Don't have an account?" line of text. This will take you to the account creation page. Enter your Mojang account information. Fill out the following fields:

Email address - The email address you want to use for your Mojang account. Repeat email address - Re-enter the email address from above. Password - The password you'll use to log into your Mojang account. Repeat password - Re-enter the password you entered above. Date of Birth - Select the day, month, and year of your birth. Click CREATE ACCOUNT. It's at the bottom of the page. This will prompt an identity verification window. Verify your identity. This usually entails selecting all images in the window that match a certain description, then clicking Verify. You may just have to enter a phrase that is displayed on the screen. Get the code that Mojang sent you. To finish creating your account, you'll need to enter a four-character code that Mojang sends to the email you entered earlier:
Go to your email inbox. Open the email from Mojang with the subject "Mojang email verification". Look for the four-character code in the body of the email. It's also after the word "verification" in the email's subject. Enter the code. Type the four-character code into the text box near the bottom of the screen. Click VERIFY. It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will create your account and take you to the Minecraft purchase page. At this point, you can proceed with purchasing Minecraft, or you can exit the page—either way, your Mojang account has been created. Migrating a Minecraft Account to a Mojang Account Go to the Mojang Account Migration page. Open https://account.mojang.com/migrate in your web browser. If you have an old Minecraft Premium account, you can migrate it to a Mojang account, which provides more security options and integrates Minecraft into your Mojang game library. Enter your Minecraft details. These are the details from your Minecraft premium account. Fill out the following fields:

E-mail - Your Minecraft Premium account's email. Username - Your Minecraft Premium username. Password - Your Minecraft Premium password. Enter your new account's details. These are the preferred details for your new Mojang account. Fill out the following fields:

E-mail - The email address you want to use. Repeat E-mail - Re-enter the email from above. Date of Birth - Select the day, month, and year of your birth. Check the "I accept..." box. It's directly below the Date of Birth section. This indicates that you accept Mojang's terms of use. Click Migrate account. It's at the bottom of the page. This will take you to an email verification page. Retrieve the code that Mojang sent you. To finish creating your account, you'll need to enter a four-character code that Mojang sends to the email you entered earlier:
Go to your email inbox. Open the email from Mojang with the subject "Mojang email verification". Look for the four-character code in the body of the email. It's also after the word "verification" in the email's subject. Enter the code. Type the four-character code into the text box near the bottom of the screen. Click VERIFY. It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will migrate your Minecraft account over to your Mojang email address.
